intro: Galium uliginosum var. ericetorum, commonly known as bog stitchwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It typically grows in moist, acidic environments such as bogs, fens, and heathlands. The plant has slender, ascending stems that are often reddish in color and bear small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and have a hairy texture. The species is characterized by its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems.
